messages.message: It also is indicating that i have 39 files when i only uploaded 8
out of curiousity did you reload the page at all? it seems as though it’s trying to classify while the digitization(?) job is still ongoing
No. I tried again and it gave me 24 files which is 4x what i uploaded
i did it a third time and now its working as expected
what do you mean “tried again”? if you upload the same file twice to build it will get uploaded twice
@daniel can you take a look here? I tried to reproduce with a new project and wasn’t able to
Just to confirm, did you upload your 8 files all at once by uploading a folder containing those files?

Yeah agreed that this is the same issue as Lee 

I think we’re supposed to block upload of other files while an existing digitization job or classification job is in progress, right?

Backend currently doesn’t block digitization job with an ongoing classification. Is there any blocking mechanism happen from Frontend?
We do block classification if there’s ongoing digitization job tho, which is why the classification call failed in Josh’s screenshot

Also, I checked the file service logs and there are four staging directories got created --- which probably explains why Josh got 4x what he uploaded. My guess is the digitization request got retired three times? Do we automatically retry digitization request from Frontend?
(The four staging directories was created by four `*Get* '/projects/<string:proj_id>/documents/staging'` calls in a span of three seconds. )
It’s possible that we retry in the case of a failed request, I’m afk so not able to check
